data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You often take some number of steps backwards. You would take 9 steps left to begin with. You would take 10 steps forward to begin with. You would take 9 steps right to begin with. So, the answer is Yes.

When you return to the starting point from where you left the first time, the direction you are on is inverted. So, the answer is No.

You must get to the starting point before taking your first step to turn the right way. If you are the "right way around" the direction to walk in is reversed. If you turn left you must get to the starting point first. So, the answer is No.

Every one of the movements involves facing straight ahead. If you run then you will always face forward. As the instructions state, "Take four steps forward," you can run as long as the number of steps are equal to the number of forward steps you take. So, the answer is No.

One takes 5 steps for the first 5 steps and the first 3 steps are 5 steps. One takes 2-3 steps then 5 steps for the next 3 steps and the last 2 steps are 4 steps. If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Every step begins with the same direction as the previous step. If someone is facing forward, the first step is always left. If someone is facing backward, it's either right or right. If someone is facing forward, it's either left or left. So in the first step, you are going forward. The second step has two steps and is going backward so you are taking 5 steps backwards. In the third step, you are going right or left and is going forward so you are taking 7 steps forward. In the fourth step, you are going up and is going forward so you are taking 2 step backwards. So in the sixth step, you are going up and is going forward so you are taking 2 step backwards. So in the seventh step, you are facing forward and is moving downward so you are taking 2 step backwards. In the ninth step, you are facing forward and is moving upward so you are taking 4 steps forward. So in the tenth step, you are facing forward and is moving downward so you are taking 1 step forward. So in the twelfth step, you are facing forward and is moving downward so you are taking 3 steps forward and 1 step backwards
